docs.lead_paragraph: A measure to prevent drug shortages and to accelerate federal review of new and generic medications won broad support, with a similar bill on a fast track to approval in the House.

headline.seo: Senate Backs Bill to Speed Drugs and Avert Shortages
headline.main: Senate Backs Bipartisan Bill to Speed Drugs and Avert Shortages
headline.print_headline: Senate Backs Bipartisan Bill to Speed Drugs and Avert Shortages

docs.abstract: Senate passes a major bipartisan bill to prevent drug shortages and to speed federal approval of lifesaving medicines, including lower-cost generic versions of biotechnology products; similar bill, strongly supported by Pres Obama, consumer groups and pharmaceutical companies, is on a fast track to approval in the House.
docs.snippet: A measure to prevent drug shortages and to accelerate federal review of new and generic medications won broad support, with a similar bill on a fast track to approval in the House.

docs.lead_paragraph: About a third of the drug samples from Southeast Asia and Africa failed in testing, according to a report by an American agency.

headline.seo: Fake and Substandard Drugs Grow as Threat to Fight Malaria
headline.main: Malaria: Fake and Substandard Drugs Grow as Threat to Fight Disease
headline.print_headline: Malaria: Fake and Substandard Drugs Grow as Threat to Fight Disease

docs.abstract: National Institutes of Health study in journal The Lancet Infectious Diseases concludes that fake and substandard malaria drugs are a growing threat to global efforts to beat back the disease.
docs.snippet: About a third of the drug samples from Southeast Asia and Africa failed in testing, according to a report by an American agency.

docs.lead_paragraph: A conversation with the economist Dana Goldman, who believes that prevention should drive health care reimbursement.

headline.main: A Long View on Health Care: Think Like an Investor
headline.print_headline: A Long View on Health Care: Think Like an Investor

docs.abstract: Interview with economist Dana Goldman, who believes that preventive care should drive health care reimbursement.
docs.snippet: A conversation with the economist Dana Goldman, who believes that prevention should drive health care reimbursement.

docs.lead_paragraph: The New Old Age Paula Span posted to nytimes.com/newoldage:

headline.main: POSTINGS | RECENT ENTRIES FROM OUR BLOGS

docs.abstract: Paula Span The New Old Age Column describes clip from Michael Rossato-Bennett documentary Alive Inside that shows an unresponsive 94-year old dementia patient becoming suddenly animated when he hears music from his youth; Tara Parker-Pope Well blog summarizes study in The New England Journal of Medicine finding that frequent coffee drinkers have a lower risk of dying from a variety of diseases. (M)
